properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm is expected. Snow will persist for much of the day today. The snow may fall heavily at times. Total snowfall accumulations near 15 cm are expected. A few locations may receive in excess of 20 cm by tonight due to lake effect snow bands from Lake Superior that will set up this evening. Snow squall warnings may be issued after the main snowfall event due to snow bands that will likely become isolated by this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T10:03:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-30T18:03:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2190859137.2020
Area: Agawa - Lake Superior Park, Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An area of low pressure over West Vancouver Island continues to spread southeast winds of 60 to 80 km/h over exposed coastal sections of East Vancouver Island and Sunshine Coast tonight. Winds will ease this evening as the low weakens. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T08:09:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-30T23:29:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0427742247.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A moist Pacific frontal system will continue to give heavy snow between Squamish and Whistler tonight. An additional 5 cm of snow is expected this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T07:59:18-00:00

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. Additional precipitation has moved into the area. A wintry mix of freezing rain and ice pellets is possible. The threat of freezing rain should end in the afternoon. Travel may be difficult at times this afternoon due to snow and possible freezing rain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T00:07:00-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system moving across the southern interior today will give snow at times heavy this morning between the Central Okanagan and Shuswap regions. Total snowfall accumulations of 10 to 15 cm are expected before the snow tapers to a few flurries this afternoon. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A moist Pacific frontal system will continue to give heavy snow between Squamish and Whistler tonight. An additional 5 cm of snow is expected this evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong winds with gusts to 90 km/h are forecast to create near zero visibilities in blowing snow. Winds are forecast to strengthen overnight tonight with winds gusting as high as 90 km/h. The strong winds will bring a return to blizzard conditions tonight before they are forecast to weaken Thursday morning. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T13:22:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-30T21:22:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2665378923.2020
Area: Grise Fiord
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today. An area of snow and possible freezing rain and ice pellets has moved into the area. Several additional centimetres of snow is likely, particularly over areas of higher terrain. Over lower terrain areas, precipitation may become mixed with rain this afternoon. Travel is expected to be difficult due to accumulating snow and possible freezing rain. Motorists and pedestrians are urged to exercise caution. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-31T04:25:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-30T20:07:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0845919428.2020
